name: Arjun Verma
feedback: Your arguments were novel and well-structured. You demonstrated excellent understanding of the motion and provided compelling evidence to support your stance. Try to back your claims with stronger data and clearer links to the motion. Work on maintaining eye contact with the judges and vary your vocal tone for better engagement.

name: Aarav Mehta
feedback: Excellent rebuttals and strong closing arguments. You effectively dismantled opposition points and reinforced your team's case with clarity. Focus on time management during your speech. Some points felt rushed towards the end. Consider using more varied examples to illustrate your arguments.

name: Priya Sharma
feedback: Outstanding delivery and argumentation. Your opening was compelling and set a strong foundation for your team's case. Excellent use of statistics and real-world examples. Work on acknowledging potential weaknesses in your case proactively. This shows awareness and strengthens your overall argument rather than leaving gaps for opponents.

name: Rohan Gupta
feedback: Good substantive content and logical flow. You built well upon your partner's arguments and provided additional depth to your team's position. Improve your POI handling - some responses were too brief. Also work on projecting confidence through body language and vocal delivery.

name: Ananya Iyer
feedback: Exceptional performance with clear structure and powerful delivery. Your definition was precise and your arguments were both logical and emotionally compelling. Consider addressing potential opposition arguments more thoroughly in your opening to strengthen your team's defensive position.

name: Karthik Reddy
feedback: Strong analytical skills and good use of evidence. You effectively supported your team's case with well-researched examples and logical reasoning. Work on making your delivery more dynamic. While your content is strong, varying your pace and tone would make your speech more engaging.

name: Sneha Patel
feedback: Strong logical framework and excellent point-by-point rebuttals. You maintained consistency throughout your speech and linked back to core principles effectively. Work on incorporating more contemporary examples to make your arguments more relatable. Also focus on varying your vocal delivery for better audience engagement.

name: Vikram Singh
feedback: Brilliant closing with powerful rhetoric and strong impact analysis. You successfully synthesized the debate and provided compelling reasons for your side's victory. Consider spending more time on direct clash with government arguments rather than just extending your own case. This would strengthen your position significantly.
